desc: Need a software that allows you to input an item (clothing) via an iPad into a database. Each item needs to have pictures, style name, size, and price (every piece of clothing will be different and no two pieces will be alike). Each item needs to then automatically be assigned a SKU which can be printed to a scanable label.  The items need to be postable gallery style to a website as well as Facebook and be able to be "claimed". once claimed it will then be added to a list. Users of the website or facebook should be able continuing "claiming" items until they click a button within the list called "done shopping" which would send a notice to  the website owner so they can then invoice them for the items. (therefore it must have a way to send invoices) and the customer can then pay via PayPal or credit card. Once a user presses "done shopping" the items need to no longer be shown on Facebook and the website. They also need to be able to select to have items shipped or to be able to pick them up. if they choose to pickup they can then have the option to pay in person. if they pay in person the website owner can process payments via card, cash or check. the software must then be able to have a way to manually make in person payments show paid. While if a payment is made online it will automatically show as paid. It must also be able to print shipping labels and show items as shipped afterwards. If items are picked up there must be a way to show them as picked up.
title: Inventory Management / Order Processing Software

desc: We are looking to expand our current platform support from iOS and Android to now include Windows mobile. Our current Android app is built in Java, so this is the best platform to start the port with.The apps display content from a CMS, the database and authentication are managed through firebase. We are currently undergoing development to add localisation support to the database and the current apps.The Windows mobile app will need to match the current app’s look and feel as closely as possible, the app must be able to receive a notification pushed by the CMS to firebase that when opened on the Windows phone, will take the user to the correct page. This may require that we set up a system to integrate FCM with Azure notification hub, our CMS is built with node.js, giving us a potential way to integrate into notification hub. You will need to advice and set up this service as well.You will be required to sign a NDA and regualry communicate and push code to our Gitlab
title: Windows Phone App Port
